intro: Gurania neogranatensis, commonly known as the Neogranatense Gurania, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
